content:
Is there any projects that use Lean4 for software verification? The famous seL4 uses Isabella. And I know Coq is commonly used in this area. But what about Lean?

Additionally, I'm considering verifying a microkernel as part of my graduation design, and I only have experience in Lean. Can you offer me some advice? Should I still use Lean or choose another ITP?

If you want to see a real-life example of software verification in Lean, you can have a look at Cedar:
https://github.com/cedar-policy/cedar-spec/tree/main/cedar-lean

Martin Dvořák said:

Thanks for the recommendation. It seems to be a relatively new project. Maybe the community is mostly focusing on mathematics. Is there anybody else who is curious about Lean in software verification and other applications in computer science?
There is the #Program verification channel in this Zulip
